definition: word for word/verbatim
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
(negative prefix)/not/no
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission

sentences.english: After a few repetitions, the child soon became word perfect .
sentences.chinese: 重複幾次後，小孩很快就能一字不差地複述了。

sentences.english: Write it down word for word.
sentences.chinese: 把它一字不差地寫下來。

sentences.english: He told me all you said, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 他一字不差地把你說的話都告訴了我。

sentences.english: He even recited certain passages from the book without a single error.
sentences.chinese: 他還背誦了書中的句子居然一字不差。

sentences.english: I tried to memorize the speech word for word.
sentences.chinese: 我竭力一字不差地記住演講稿。

sentences.english: She told me exactly what he said, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 她一字不差地告訴我他所說的話。

sentences.english: The President's speeches are regularly reproduced verbatim in the state -run newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 總統的講話通常會被一字不差地刊登在國有報紙上。

sentences.english: She repeated their conversation word for word to me.
sentences.chinese: 她一字不差地把他們的談話對我複述了一遍。

sentences.english: A truer word was never spoken.

definition: see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
without missing a word
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
to pass on (stories)/to relate
to recite/to repeat from memory
weighing every word
sticking unmoving to the original (idiom); not an iota changed/untouched
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
to write from memory
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
